There are five of them. One is wearing the armor. Wouldn’t it be more practical to keep the damn thing in a chest?
“You are not Esdras,” says the leader – an older, heavy-set man with droopy eyes. “I didn’t like that shifty fuck. I knew he would try something, but I didn’t think he would send one <man/woman>. How would you like a demonstration?”
He nods and the man wearing the armor steps forward.

He nods and the man wearing the armor steps forward.

dlgAnsw.text: “Hold it, brother, if you want to live.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Who are you?” the leader asks cautiously, which is a good sign. Clearly, he’s well aware that robe-clad <men/women> can wield as much power – if not more – than armored knights.

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise][impersonate]“Do you know that buying or selling holy relics is forbidden? That it is, in fact, a crime of blasphemy punishable by death?”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“I’ve never heard of this law,” says the man. He doesn’t sound very convinced as Ganezzar does have a reputation when it comes to things of religious nature.

dlgAnsw.text: [lore][persuasion]“Ignorantia juris non excusat – ignorance of the law doesn’t excuse. Normally, those found guilty of the crime are blinded, drawn, and quartered, but I suppose I can pull a few strings and replace the punishment with beheading, but don’t ask me for any more favors.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“We have no relics here, <brother/sister>,” says the man, gesturing around as if inviting you to take a look.
“What about it?” asks the man, feigning ignorance. “With respect, <brother/sister>, not every old armor is a relic.”

dlgAnsw.text: [lore success]“It's the famed pre-War armor, forged from tempered blue steel and infused with raw Power harnessed from other planes.”
[streetwise success]“No? So I suppose that my eyes deceive me and this isn’t, in fact, the famed armor worn by the Temple Guards? Armor blessed by the Gods and infused with the divine breath?”
“This one is and you know it.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“I don’t know anything about it and I don’t think you do either.”
It seems the conversation has run its course.

dlgAnsw.text: Kill them all. Yes, wearing nothing but a bathrobe.
Leave. This armor is probably broken anyway.

[persuasion][streetwise]“The relic will be taken, one way or another. You will not be allowed to sell it for such an act is a sin of the worst kind or to leave the city with it. The only question is whether or not to take your lives with it as well.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“You can’t be serious!” protests the man. “I'm telling you, we didn't know!”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion][streetwise]“The relic will be taken, one way or another. You will not be allowed to sell it for such an act is a sin of the worst kind or to leave the city with it. The only question is whether or not to take your lives with it as well.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“What if we willingly surrender it to you?” asks the man, his eyes alive with hope.

dlgAnsw.text: “Such an act would definitely please the Gods and my brothers. I graciously accept.”

dlgPart.npc_text: The mercenary leader gestures and the man wearing the armor quickly removes it and passes it on to you.
